alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 11:11AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of San Luis Obispo County in southwest California. * WHEN...Until 315 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1106 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause minor urban and small stream flooding, including roadway flooding. - Additional rain is expected into the evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Nipomo, Cambria, Highway 101 and Hearst Castle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Slow down on roads and highways. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
